thread.title: How to get an absentee ballot in Onondaga County
thread.title_full: How to get an absentee ballot in Onondaga County | syracuse.com

author: Michelle Breidenbach | mbreidenbach@syracuse.com
title: How to get an absentee ballot in Onondaga County
text:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. - If you can't vote in person Nov. 3, here is how to get an absentee ballot.
You have to apply.
Find an application on the Onondaga County Board of Elections website at ongov.net/elections.
Fill it out and postmark it by Oct. 27 or drop it off in person by 5 p.m. Nov. 2.
You can find the Onondaga County Board of Elections in Syracuse at 1000 Erie Boulevard West. Contact them at 435-3312.
The office will stay open late and add Saturday hours on the following dates:
Tuesday, Oct. 20: 8:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21: 8:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24: 9 a.m. to noon Monday, Oct. 26: 8:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 27: 8:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 31: 9 a.m. to noon Monday, Nov. 2: 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
If you get sick after Oct. 27, you can send a representative to the board of elections to apply for an absentee ballot.
This is who qualifies for an absentee ballot:
Members of the military and their dependents. Voters who are out of the county. Voters who are ill. Voters who are permanently disabled. Voters who are unable to vote in person due to religious scruples. Voters who have duties for the board of elections. Voters who are victims of domestic violence. See who is the ballot in Onondaga County.
Contact Michelle Breidenbach 315-470-3186
